description: OBJECTIVE: The objective of this project is to conduct herring tagging and deploy acoustic receivers to obtain data on herring spatial distribution and migration patterns in Fortune Bay. SCOPE OF WORK: The work will involve searching Fortune Bay for aggregations of herring, loosely catching herring in a purse, bar or tuck seine in order for DFO staff to dipnet around 250 live herring into large containers on board the vessel. DFO staff will then conduct acoustic tagging on a subset of the catch and release all fish back into the ocean. The work will also involve assisting in the deployment of 5-10 acoustic receivers in Fortune Bay. Conditional Set-Aside under the Federal Government Procurement Strategy for Indigenous Business (PSIB) This is an open tender. However, it will be conditionally set-aside under the Government of Canada’s Procurement Strategy for Indigenous Business (PSIB) if two or more bids have been received by Indigenous businesses who are certified under the Procurement Strategy for Indigenous Business (PSIB) criteria and who may be listed in the Government of Canada’s Indigenous Business Directory.
full_summary:
=====================================

##Procurement Notice##
=====================

###Project Title: ###
TODO Project titled Fortune Bay Acoustic Herring Tagging Project.

###Procurement Reference:###
cb-370-73137364

###Solicitation Reference:###
30005682

###Notice Type:###
Request for Proposal (RFP)

###Description of Goods and Services:###
The objective of this project is to conduct a comprehensive acoustic herring tagging study in Fortune Bay, using a Research Vessel (UNSPSC 25111534) to obtain data on herring spatial distribution and migration patterns.

###Scope of Work:###
* Searching Fortune Bay for aggregations of herring
* Capturing herring using purse, bar or tuck seine
* Dipping netting and tagging of approximately 250 live herring
* Deployment and retrieval of 5-10 acoustic receivers in Fortune Bay
* Operating trap hauler/winch during deployment and retrieval of acoustic receivers

###Conditional Set-Aside:###
Under the Government of Canada’s federal Indigenous Business Strategy, this procurement will be conditionally set-aside for Indigenous businesses if two or more bids are received from certified and listed businesses.

###Procurement Method:###
Competitive – Open Bidding

###Evaluation Criteria:###
Procurement will be awarded to the bidder with the lowest price submitted in accordance with the evaluation criteria.

###Clauses:###
The contract will be issued in accordance with Treasury Board Contracting Policy requirements.

###Additional Information:###
Files are located on the Bidder Lookup portal and can be downloaded from CanadaBuys ([https://canada.ca](https://canada.ca) )

###Contracting Agency:###
Fisheries and Oceans Canada, 301 Bishop Drive, Fredericton, NB, E3C 2M6

###Certification Office Contact:###
Karen Dolan
782-377-7245
karen.dolan@dfo-mpo.gc.ca

###Effective Date of this Notice:signup###
25 May 2024

###Last Date to Receive Bids:signup###
6 Jun 2024 

###More Information:###
